I rebased onto trunk and picked the versions on trunk when there were conflicts. It turns out that most of the controversial 'info' logs already made it to trunk.
@ijuma Thank you for the review, merging to trunk.
@ijuma Should I merge to 0.11.0 as well? It is an issue only if the test fails, so perhaps not necessary?
Since this is completely safe, it's OK to backport to 0.11.0 as well.
@ijuma Thanks, merging to both...

@kkonstantine @rhauch @ijuma Not sure if this will address KAFKA-5141, but in the process of taking a quick look at it I noticed some brokenness in this test. First, I found that `verifyAll()` was not being called in a few tests. Not strictly wrong, but we were missing some intended checks.

After adding those, I noticed that some mocks were actually being created *after* `replayAll()`, which is incorrect. Fixed those up, a few other missing pieces that fell out of those changes (mainly missing expectations).

I also had to remove some expectations because of mocking of the classloader modifications -- we were marking some calls as expected, but since the classloaders aren't really swapped out, we shouldn't expect them. And in fact we were missing a few as well. I'm not sure if it is better to do things this way (where I've now noted what we would expect but don't see) or to just swap out the classloader. In practice a new MockClassLoader is put in place for every test anyway, so it's relatively safe (and I have verified that just removing mockStatic on the `Plugins` class works fine).

There's also a bit of reorganization in some methods to make the order of operations on the mocks a bit clearer.

This should go on both trunk and 0.11.0.

Note I opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-5441 for the grouping problem. I don't think we need to fix it for this release, but it would probably be good to understand how it can happen so that we can write a better test case.
